1. Government incentives: The city of San Francisco, California, provides tax incentives to businesses that implement green measures, such as solar panels and installing energy-efficient lights. This program has been very effective in encouraging businesses to adopt sustainable practices.

2. Education and training: The city of Seattle, Washington, provides sustainable business training and workshops to help businesses make sustainable decisions. Restaurant workers in this city have been trained on composting, and the city has seen compost rates increase by 25% because of this initiative.

3. Public recognition and awards: In Portland, Oregon, the Sustainable Business Network started the Portland Sustainability at Work program, which recognizes businesses that adopt sustainable practices. This program has led to many businesses adopting sustainable practices, such as reducing water use, recycling waste, and using LED lights.

4. Collaboration: The city of Amsterdam, Netherlands, has created the Circular Amsterdam program, a public-private partnership that works with businesses to help them adopt circular economy principles. This program has helped many businesses reduce waste, create new products from recycled materials, and adopt more sustainable practices.

5. Certification programs: In New York City, the NYC Carbon Challenge program provides support and resources for large businesses to reduce their carbon footprint. Businesses can become certified as a NYC Carbon Challenge participant by implementing sustainability measures, such as reducing energy use, increasing recycling, and using renewable energy.

6. Sustainable supply chains: The Sustainable Advancement of Food and Environment (SAFE) program in California provides incentives to farmers who adopt sustainable practices, which has led to many farms becoming more environmentally friendly.

7. Green marketing: A local coffee shop in Portland, Oregon, called Sustainable Harvest, markets itself as an environmentally friendly company. This has helped the business to attract environmentally conscious customers and differentiate itself from competitors.

These examples show that these methods can be effective in promoting sustainability among local businesses and in various locations.
